result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

On one or more charges in this case, Anthony C Thomas was found not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect. The defendant was found guilty of actually committing the crime(s) charged, but was also found not to be legally responsible under Wis. Stats. 971.165 for committing the crime(s) because of the defendant's mental condition. The legal effect of a finding of not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect is that the court must commit the defendant to the custody of the Department of Health and Family Services.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty but Not Guilty Due to Mental Disease/Defect

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty but Not Guilty Due to Mental Disease/Defect

Defendant Anthony C Thomas in court with attorney David E Saperstein.  Leigh M Neville-Neil appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has filed a motion for termination of his conditional release.  Attorney Neville-Neil states that there are doctor's reports on file but no recommendation for release and requests an adjournment to allow time for Attorney Knaapen to contact the doctors.  Attorney Saperstein makes a statement in support of his motion.  Court will reschedule the matter for a status conference.  Status conference scheduled for August 22, 2018 at 08:45 am.

Court reviews with the defendant the proper procedures need to move forward.  Court notes for the record that the cash bond has been returned.

cover letter from Attorney Saperstein

Defendant Anthony C Thomas in court with attorney David E Saperstein.  Michael Daniel Zell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Officer German Olivarez is sworn and questioned by Attorney Zell. Testifies to responding to a complaint of an intoxicated driver.  Testifies to stopping a vehicle that the defendant was driving.  Witness identifies the defendant in the courtroom.  Testifies to his observations of the defendant at the time of the stop.  Witness reviews Exhibit 1.  Exhibit 1 is received.  Cross-examination by Attorney Saperstein.  Questions witness at length regarding the defendant's condition at the time of the stop.  Re-direct by Attorney Zell.  

Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and that the defendant committed it. Bond is continued.  Court accepts the NGI plea and the parties will discuss who will conduct the evaluation.
